juzs.text: And those who do not hope to meet Us say, "Why have not angels been sent down on us or (why) do we not see our Lord?" They are indeed proud of themselves and they revolted with a great revolt
The day they will see the angels, on that day it will not be a good news for the criminals, and they will say, "(May we be) prevented (from that through some) prevention
And We will turn to the work which they did, then We will make it as scattered dust
On that day the place/time of stay of the inhabitants of the garden will be good, and their resting place the best
And on that day the sky will be split with the clouds (coverings) and the angels will be sent down, descending
The kingdom on that day, as a right, will be of the Beneficent (God), and the day will be difficult for the disbelievers
And on that day the unjust will bite his hands saying, "I wish I had taken a way with the messenger
O sorrowful is my state, I wish I had not taken such a one as a friend
he has misled me from the reminder after it had come to me, and the devil is a traitor for man
And the messenger says, "O my Lord ! my people have certainly taken this Quran as a forsaken thing
And thus did We make for every prophet, an enemy from among the criminals, and your Lord is sufficient as a Guide and a Helper

And those who do not believe say, "Why has not the whole Quran been sent down on him all at once?" Thus (We have not sent it down all at once) that We may make your heart firm through it, and (therefore) We have caused the Quran to be recited to you gradually (in portions, after) intervals
And they do not come to you with any similitude (question or problem) but We give you the correct (answer) with the best explanation
Those who will be gathered towards hell on their faces, those will be in an evil place and away from the way
And We gave the book to Moses and We made his brother Aaron responsible with him
Then We said, "Both of you go to the people who have denied Our signs." Then We destroyed them (with a total) destruction
And the people of Noah, when they denied the messengers, We drowned them and We made them a sign for mankind. And We have prepared for those who are unjust, a painful punishment
and (also for) Aad and Thamud and the inhabitants of the Rass and many generations between them
And for everyone We had set forth examples and everyone We destroyed (with a total) destruction
And indeed they have passed by the town on which was rained an evil rain, did they not then see it? No, they do not hope to be raised (after death)
And when they see you, they do not take you for anything but mockery (saying), "Is this the one whom God has raised as a messenger
He would have almost misled us from our gods had we not patiently adhered to them. And they will know when they" see the punishment, who is more astray from the way
Have you seen him who takes his desire (as) his god, (he who follows only his desire and nothing else)? Then will you be a trustee over him
Or do you think that the majority of them hears or understands? They are nothing but like cattle, no, they are more astray from the way
Did you not consider (the work of) your Lord, how He stretches the shade (which ultimately ends in night)? And had He willed he could have made it stationary. Then We have made the sun its guide
Then We draw it towards Ourselves, an easy in drawing
And He it is Who has made the night a covering for you and the sleep a (source of) rest and He has made the day for rising up again
And He it is Who sends the winds (giving) good news before His mercy, and We send down from the sky clean water
that We may give life through it to a dead land and We make many cattle and human beings, whom We created, to drink it
And We have repeated it among them that they may be mindful, but the majority of mankind refuses (everything) except disbelief
And had We willed We would have raised a warner in every town
So do not obey the disbelievers and strive against them with it ( the Quran), a great striving

And He it is Who has let free the two seas, one that quenches thirst, sweet; and the other saltish, bitter. And He has made between them a barrier and prevented (them from getting mixed up, by a) prevention
And He it is Who created man from water and has appointed for him blood relationships and marriage relationships and your Lord is Powerful
And they serve (worship) besides God that which neither profits them nor harms them. And the disbeliever is one who helps against his Lord
And We have not sent you except as a conveyer of good news and as a warner
Say, "I do not ask you for a reward for this, except that whoever wills, he may take a way towards His Lord
And put your trust in the Living Who does not die and glorify (Him) by praising Him, and He is sufficient as One informed of the sins of His servants

(He it is) Who created the skies and the earth and that which is between these two in six days (periods) then He set the balance on the throne (of the universe), the Beneficent (God), so ask one who is informed about Him
And when it is said to them, "Prostrate before the Beneficent (God)," they say, "And what is the Beneficent? Shall we prostrate before anything you enjoin on us?" And it increases their hatred
Blessed is He Who has made galaxies in the sky and made in it (the sun as) a lamp, and a radiant moon (reflecting sun light)
And He it is Who has made the night and the day succeeding (each other) for one who intends to be mindful or intends to be grateful
And the servants of the Beneficent (God) are those who walk on the earth in humility, and when the ignorant address them they say, "Peace
And those who spend the night prostrating and standing before their Lord
And those who say, "Our Lord! turn away from us the punishment of hell." Its punishment is certainly a lasting difficulty
It is certainly an evil dwelling place/time for staying
And those who, when they spend, are neither extravagant nor niggardly and their (spending) is established between these (two limits)

And those who do not pray to another (presumed) god along with God, and do not kill any person whose (killing) God has forbidden except in (the cause) of truth, and they do not commit adultery and whoever does that, he will meet (the punishment of his) sin
The punishment will be doubled for him on the day of resurrection and he will stay therein, disgraced
except he who repented and believed and did righteous work, then for them God will change their evil deeds to good deeds, and God is Protectively Forgiving, Merciful
And he who repents and does righteous work, then he is certainly the one who turns to God in (true) repentance
And those who do not witness falsehood, and when they pass by that which is vain, they pass by honourably
And those who, when they are reminded through the signs of their Lord, do not fall down thereat (as if) deaf and blind
And those who say, "Our Lord! grant to us through our wives and descendants comfort of the eyes and make us leaders of those who guard (against evil)
Those will be rewarded with high places, because they were patient, and they will be met therein with greetings and peace
They will stay therein, excellent will be the dwelling place/ time for staying
Say, "My Lord does not (even) care for you all if you do not pray (to Him), and you have denied so (the consequence of) it will be inevitable." (R 6, P 18 ¼)
Taa Siin Miim
Those are the signs of the book that makes clear
You will perhaps kill yourself with grief because they do not believe
If We will, We can send down on them a sign from the sky, so that their necks would remain bowed down before it
And there does not come to them any new reminder from the Beneficent (God) but they turn away from it
So they have denied (it), therefore the news of that which they mock at, will come to them
Did they not see towards the earth how many beneficial (things) of every kind have We caused to grow in it
There is certainly a sign in that but the majority of them does not believe
And your Lord ! He is certainly the Mighty, the Merciful
And when your Lord called out to Moses, that, "Go to the unjust people
people of Pharaoh. Will they not guard (against evil)
He said, "My Lord! I fear that they will deny me
further, my bosom straitens and my language is not fluent, so send for Aaron (to help me)
And they have (the charge of) a crime against me so I fear that they will kill me
He said, "By no means, so both of you go with Our signs, We are with you, Hearing
So go to Pharaoh then say: We are sent (by) the Lord of the worlds (with a message)
that you should send the children of Israel with us
He (Pharaoh) said, "Were you not fostered among us as a child? And you did stay among us for many years of your life
and you did that deed of yours which you did and you are of the ungrateful ones
He said, "I did it then, when I was of those in error
so I fled from you when I feared you, but my Lord granted me wisdom and made me one of the messengers
Now (should) that favour with which you favoured me (become the cause) for your enslaving the children of Isreal?”
Pharaoh said, "And who is the Lord of the worlds
He said, "The Lord of the skies and the earth and that which is between them, if you (want) to be of those who are certain
He said to those around him, "Do you not hear
He said, "Your Lord and the Lord of your ancient fathers
He said, "Your messenger who has been sent to you is certainly possessed by jinn
He said, "Lord of the east and the west and that which is between them, if you have sense
He said, "If you take a god other than me I will definitely place you among the prisoners
He said, "Even if I bring to you something as a clear proof
He said, "Then bring it, if you are of the truthful ones
So he threw down his staff when it became a clear serpent
and he drew out his hand when it became white for those who were seeing
He (Pharaoh) said to the leaders (of his community) around him, "This is certainly a learned magician
he intends to drive you out from your land by his magic, so what do you advise
They said, "Keep him and his brother (waiting) in hope and send into the cities (your officials) who gather (people)
(so that) they should bring to you every learned magician
So the magicians were gathered at the appointed time on a known day
And it was said to the people, "Will you gather
so that we may follow the magicians if they are the winners
So when the magicians came, they said to Pharaoh, "Is there a sure reward for us if we are the winners
He said, "Yes, then you will certainly be of those who are near (to me)
Moses said to them, "Cast down what you are going to cast down
So they cast down their ropes and their rods and said, "By the might of Pharaoh we will certainly be winners
Then Moses cast down his staff when it swallowed that which they had falsely devised
Consequently the magicians were thrown down prostrating
They said, "We believe in the Lord of the worlds
Lord of Moses and Aaron

He (Pharaoh) said, "You believe in him before I give you permission, he is certainly your chief who taught you magic, but you will know, I will definitely cut off your hands and your feet from opposite sides and I will definitely crucify you all together
They said, "No harm, we will return to our Lord
we certainly hope that our Lord will protectively forgive us our faults, because we are the first of the believers
And We communicated to Moses that, "Take away my servants by night, you will be pursued
So Pharaoh sent into the cities (his officials) who gathered (people)
(saying), "They are certainly a small party
and they have angered us
and we are an alert army
Thus did We drive them out from gardens and springs
and treasures and an honoured position
Like that (it happened). And We made the children of Israel to inherit them
So they pursued them at sunrise
So when the two parties saw each other, the companions of Moses said, "We are caught
He said, "By no means, My Lord is certainly with me, He will guide me
So We communicated to Moses that, "Strike the sea with your staff," so it was split and each part became like a great mountain
And We brought others near, there (at the same place)
and We delivered Moses and those with him, all together
then We drowned the others
In that there is certainly a sign, but the majority of them does not believe
And your Lord, He is certainly the Mighty, the Merciful
And Tell them the story of Abraham
when he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship
They said, "We worship idols and we will remain sticking to them
He said, "Do they listen to you when you pray to (them)
or benefit you or harm you
They said, "No, we found our fathers doing like that
He said, "Then do you see, that which you worship
you and your fathers before you
For they are enemies to me except the Lord of the worlds
Who created me, then He it is Who guides me
and Who feeds me and gives me to drink
and when I am sick, then He it is Who cures me
and Who will cause me to die, then give me life (again)
and (from) Whom I hope, that He will protectively forgive me my mistakes on the day of judgment
My Lord! grant me wisdom and join me with the righteous
and assign for me a true mention among later (generations)
and place me among the inheritors of the garden of bliss
and protectively forgive my father, he is certainly among those who are astray
and do not disgrace me on the day they are raised (again)
the day on which neither wealth nor sons will benefit
except him who comes to God with a pure heart
And the garden will be brought near for those who guard (against evil)
And the hell will be made manifest to the erring ones
And it will be said to them, "Where are those whom you used to worship
besides God? Can they help you or help themselves
Then they will be thrown headlong into it, they and the misleaders
and the army of Iblis (devil), all together
They will say while they quarrel therein
By God, we were certainly in clear error
when we considered you equal to the Lord of the worlds
and no one has misled us except the criminals
so we have no mediators
and no intimate friend
So if we are given (another chance to) return (to the world), then we will certainly be of those who believe
There is certainly a sign in that, but the majority of them does not believe
And your Lord, He is certainly the Mighty, the Merciful
The people of Noah denied the messengers
when their brother Noah said to them, "Will you not guard (against evil)
I am certainly a trustworthy messenger to you
so fear God and obey me
and l do not ask you for any reward for it, my reward is with none but the Lord of the worlds
so fear God and obey me
They said, "Shall we believe in you when the worst (people) follow you
He said, "And what knowledge do I have of what they do
(The responsibility of taking) their account is on none but my Lord, if you (could only) realize
And I am not (supposed) to drive away the believers
I am nothing but a plain warner
They said, "If you do not desist, O Noah! you will definitely be of those who are stoned (to death)
He said, "My Lord! my people have certainly denied me
so decide between me and them (by pronouncing) a judgment, and deliver me and those of the believers who are with me
So We delivered him and those with him, in the loaded ship
Then after that We drowned those who remained behind
There is certainly a sign in that, but the majority of them does not believe
And your Lord, He is certainly the Mighty, the Merciful
The (people of) Aad denied the messengers
when their brother Hud said to them, "Will you not guard (against evil)
I am certainly a trustworthy messenger to you
so fear God and obey me
and I do not ask you for any reward for it, my reward is with none but the Lord of the worlds
Do you build a monument on every high place, without any purpose
And you take (for dwellings) strong fortresses that perhaps you may stay (in them for ever)
And when you take hold (of people), you take hold (of them) as tyrants
So fear God and obey me
And fear Him Who helped you with that which you know
He has helped you with cattle and sons
and gardens and springs
I certainly fear for you the punishment of the great day
They said, "It is equal to us whether you admonish or you do not be of those who admonish
This is nothing but a customary (warning) of the ancient
and we will not be punished
Thus they denied him, therefore We destroyed them, there is certainly a sign in that, but the majority of them does not believe
And your Lord, He is certainly the Mighty, the Merciful
The (people of) Thamud denied the messengers
when their brother Saleh said to them, "Will you not guard (against evil)
I am certainly a trustworthy messenger to you
so fear God and obey me
And I do not ask you for any reward for it, my reward is with none but the Lord of the worlds
Will you be left secure in that which is here
in gardens and springs
and cultivations and date palms, the spathes of which break (due to the weight of the fruit)
And you exultingly carve houses out of mountains
so fear God and obey me
and do not obey the command of the extravagant
who cause corruption in the earth and do not act aright
They said, "You are only one of the bewitched
you are nothing but a man like us, so bring a sign if you are of the truthful ones
He said, "This is a she-camel, for it there (is a portion of water for) drinking and for you (a portion of water for) drinking on a known day
And do not afflict her with evil lest the punishment of a great day seize you
But they stabbed her then became regretters
So the punishment seized them, there is certainly a sign in that, but the majority of them does not believe
And your Lord, He is certainly the Mighty, the Merciful. (R)
The people of Lot denied the messengers
when their brother Lot said to them, "Will you not guard (against evil)
I am certainly a trustworthy messenger to you
so fear God and obey me
and I do not ask you for any reward for it, my reward is with none but the Lord of the worlds
What! of all creatures you approach males
and leave those of your wives whom your Lord has created for you? No, you are a transgressing people
They said, "If you do not desist, O Lot! you will definitely be of those who are driven out
He said, "I am certainly of those who hate your acts
My Lord ! deliver me and my followers from that which they do
So We delivered him and his followers all together
except an old woman, (who was) among those who remained behind
Then We destroyed the others
and We rained on them a rain, so evil was the rain of those who were warned
There is certainly a sign in that, but the majority of them does not believe
And your Lord, He is certainly the Mighty, the Merciful (R)
The inhabitants of the jungle denied the messengers
when Shuaib said to them, "Will you not guard (against evil)
I am certainly a trustworthy messenger to you
so fear God and obey me
and I do not ask you for any reward for it, my reward is with none but the Lord of the worlds
Give back full measure and do not be of those who cause loss
And weigh with a balance that is straight (correct)
and do not give less to people, the things due to them, and do not cause disturbance in the earth being corrupt
and fear Him Who created you and the ancient generations
They said, "You are only one of the bewitched
and you are nothing but a man like us, and our guess about you is that you are of those who lie
Then make pieces from the sky to fall on us if you are of the truthful ones
He said, "My Lord knows best about what you do
So they denied him therefore the punishment of the over shadowing cloud seized them, it was certainly a punishment of a great day
There is certainly a sign in that, but the majority of them does not believe
And your Lord, He is certainly the Mighty, the Merciful
And the (Quran) has certainly been sent down by the Lord of the worlds
the trustworthy spirit came down with it
on your heart that you may be (one) of the warners
in plain Arabic language
and it is (mentioned) in ancient scriptures (too)
Is it not a sign for them that the learned (men among) the children of Israel know it
And had We sent it down on any of the foreigners
and had he recited it to them, they would not have believed in it
Thus did We cause it to enter into the hearts of the criminals
(that) they should not believe in it till they see the painful punishment
which will come upon them suddenly while they are not conscious
then they will say, "Shall we be given time (for amendment)
What ! do they still seek to hasten on Our punishment
Then do you see? If We make them enjoy for years
then there comes to them that which they were promised
(at that time), that which they were made to enjoy will not be of any use to them
And We did not destroy any town but it had its warners
(for) reminding, and We are not unjust
And the devils have not come down with the (Quran)
and it neither suits them nor are they capable (of doing it)
(on the contrary) they have been removed far away (even) from hearing (it)
So do not pray to another (presumed) god with God, lest you be of those who are punished
And warn your family (consisting) of close relatives
And lower your wing for him who follows you from among the believers
And if they disobey you then say, "I am certainly free of that which you do
And put your trust in the Mighty, the Merciful
Who sees you when you stand
and your movements among those who prostrate
He is certainly the Hearing, the Knowing
Should I inform you (of those) on whom the devils come down
They come down on every liar, sinner
they deliver hearsay and most of them are liars
And the poets, those in error follow them
Do you not see that they wander distracted in every valley
and that they say that which they do not practice

except those who believe and do righteous works and remember God much, and defend themselves after the in-justice that is done to them? And those who are unjust will know, to which place of turning back they will turn back
Taa Siin. Those are the signs of' the Quran and a book that makes clear
a guidance and good news for the believers
who establish worship (salat) and give charity (zakat) and they are certain of the hereafter
For those who do not believe in the hereafter, We have certainly made their deeds fair seeming to them, so they blindly wander
those are the persons for whom there is a severe punishment and in the hereafter they will be the greatest losers
And you are certainly made to receive the Quran from the Wise, the Knowing
When Moses said to his family, "I perceive a fire, I will bring information to you from it or I will come to you with a flaming and burning brand, so that you may warm yourselves
So when he came to it, a voice was heard that, "Blessed is whoever is in the fire and whoever is around it and glory be to God the Lord of the worlds
O Moses ! I am God, the Mighty, the Wise
And throw your staff," then when he saw it moving as if it were a snake he turned back retreating and did not return. "O Moses! do not fear, the messengers do not fear (when they are) with Me
nor he who was unjust, then he changed it (with) good after the evil, for I am certainly Protectively Forgiving, Merciful
And enter your hand into (the opening of) your bosom, it will come out white without any evil. (These are) among the nine signs to Pharaoh and his people, they are certainly a transgressing people
So when Our visible signs came to them, they said, "This is clear magic
And they knowingly denied it unjustly and proudly while they were certain about it (in) their souls (minds). Then see how the end of those who were corrupt, was (brought about)
And We had given knowledge to David and Solomon and they said, "Praise is due only for God Who has preferred us above many of His believing servants
And Solomon was David's heir and he said, "O mankind! we have been taught the speech of birds and we have been given of everything. This is certainly a clear grace
And his armies of the jinn and human beings and the birds were gathered before Solomon and they were formed into ordered ranks
until when they came to a valley of the ants, an ant said, "O you ants! enter your houses lest Solomon and his armies crush you while they do not perceive

So he smiled (and) laughed at its statement and said, "My Lord! grant me such orderliness that I should be grateful for Your favour with which You have favoured me and my parents, and that I should do such righteouswork which should please You; and admit me by Your mercy, among Your righteous servants
And he sought for the birds, then said, "How is it that I do not see the hoopoe or is he among those who arc absent
I will definitely punish him with a severe punishment or slaughter him or he should definitely come to me with a clear authority (justifying his absence)
So without making (him) wait for long (the hoopoe came) and said, "I have acquired (knowledge) of that which you do not know, and I bring to you true news from Saba
I found a woman ruling over them and she has been given of everything and she has a great throne
I found her and her people prostrating to the sun besides God, and the devil has made their deeds fair seeming to them and turned them away from the way, so they are misguided (to the extent)
that they do not prostrate to God Who brings forth that which is hidden in the skies and the earth and knows that which you hide and that which you make public
God, there is no god except Him, He is the Lord of the great throne (of the universe)
He said, "We will see whether you speak the truth or you are of the liars
Go with this letter of mine and deliver it to them, then turn away from them and see what (answer) they return
(The Queen) said, "O you chiefs! an honourable letter has been delivered to me
it is from Solomon, and it is: In the name of God, the Beneficent, the Merciful
that, exalt not yourselves against me and come to me as those who submit (as Muslims)." (R)
She said, "O you chiefs! advise me in this affair of mine, I do not decide an affair until you are present with me
They said, "We are endued with strength and endued to fight severely, and it is on you to command, therefore you see what you (wish) to command
She said When kings enter a township, they certainly cause disorder in it, and make the mightiest of its people most disgraced and thus they (too) will do
and I am sending a gift to them, so as to see with (what answer) the messengers return

So when be (the envoy) came to Solomon he said, "What ! will you help me with wealth? But that which God has given me is better than that which he has given you. No, it is you who are happy with your gift (not I)
Return to them, and we will definitely come to them with armies which they will not be able to oppose, and we will definitely drive them out from there, disgraced, and they will be degraded
He said “O you chiefs ! which of you will bring her throne to me before they come to me surrendering (as Muslims)
One cleverly alert among the String Jinn said, "I will bring it to you before you rise from your place and I certainly have the reliable strength to do it

One who had knowledge of the book* said, "I will bring it to you before the blinking of your eye." So when he saw it settled in his presence, he said, "This is (something) from the grace of my Lord to test me whether I am grateful or ungrateful, and one who is grateful, then his being grateful is only for (the benefit of) his own soul and one who is ungrateful, then my Lord is certainly Independent, Honourable
He said, "Make her throne unrecognizable for her, we will see whether she is capable of receiving guidance or she is of those who are not capable of receiving guidance
So when she came, it was said to her, "Is your throne like this?" She said, "It is just like it and we were given the know edge before it and we have submitted (as Muslims)
And that which she worshipped besides God, had hindered her (earlier), she was certainly of the people who were disbelievers

It was said to her, “Enter the palace.” So when she saw it, she thought it to be an expanse of water and removed (the covering) from her ankles (to cross it). He (Solomon) said, "It is a palace made smooth with glass.” She said, “My Lord! I have been unjust to myself and I submit with Solomon to God, the Lord of the worlds
And We indeed sent to Thamud their brother Saleh, (saying) that, “Serve God,” when they became two parties disputing (with each other)
He said, “O my people! why do you seek to hasten on the evil before the good, why do you not seek protective forgiveness of God that you may be dealt with mercifully?”
They said, “We have met with ill luck because of you and because of those with you." He said, “Your ill luck is with God, no, you are a people who are being tested.”
And there were nine persons in the city who caused corruption in the land and did not act right

They said, “Swear to each other by God that we will definitely attack him and his people by night, then we will definitely say to his heir: we did not witness the destruction of his people and we certainly speak the truth.”
And they planned a plan and We (too) planned a plan while they did not perceive
Then see what was the end of their plan, We destroyed them and their people all together
So those are their houses fallen down because they were unjust, there is certainly a sign in that for a people who know
And We delivered those who believed and who had guarded (against evil)
And (We sent) Lot, when he said to his people, “Why do you commit indecency while approach men besides women? No, you are an ignorant people.”
What! Do you indeed lustfully approach men besides women? No, you are an ignorant people
